snippet: Three current major leaguers graduated from Redan High School, which has an enrollment that is 98 percent black and a baseball program that produces one of the school’s most successful sports teams.
abstract: Cincinnati Reds second baseman Brandon Phillips is one of three current major leaguers who graduated from east metropolitan Atlanta's Redan High School, which has an enrollment that is 98 percent black and a baseball program that produces one of school’s most successful sports teams; MLB has created task force to examine how to boost its number of black players, who accounted for only about 8.5 percent of opening-day rosters in 2013.

byline.contributor: Andrew Keh contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Three current major leaguers graduated from Redan High School, which has an enrollment that is 98 percent black and a baseball program that produces one of the school’s most successful sports teams.

headline.main: In Georgia Town, Hints of More Diverse Future for Major Leagues
